org.jirduino.drivers

Interface IRDevice

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    IRLib2Device, RawDriver

    public interface IRDevice
    IRDuino Java generic interface for IR devices. This is an Abstract interface communications for Arduino different IR libraries
    Author:
    Emanuele Paiano

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      Disconnect IR Device, closing connection with Arduino

    • Method Detail

      • init

        boolean init()
        Initialize IR Device
        Returns:
        true if success, false otherwise

      • getArduino

        ArduinoSerialMonitor getArduino()
        Get Arduino Serial Monitor

      • sendHexValue

        boolean sendHexValue(int protocolId,
                     java.lang.String command,
                     int bits)
        send Hex Value command. Simulate a single pressing remote button
        Parameters:
        command - hex command string (i.e. NECx.POWER_KEY or E0E040BF)
        protocolId - protocol number
        bits - bit number (protocol)
        Returns:
        true if success, false otherwise

      • sendData

        boolean sendData(Signal value)
        send signal command. It work like sendHexValue(), but with signal object
        Parameters:
        value - command signal (i.e. new Signal(7, "E0E040BF")).
        Returns:
        true if success, false otherwise

      • receiveHexValue

        java.lang.String receiveHexValue()
        Wait for receive response from remote IR Device and extract HEX value. You should enable receiver first, calling setReceiverEnable(true).
        Returns:
        Comamnd hex value as string

      • receiveData

        Signal receiveData()
        Wait for receive response from remote IR Device and return object containing protocolID and Hex value command. You should enable receiver first, calling setReceiverEnable(true).
        Returns:
        [ProtocolID, HexValue] as Item

      • receiveProtocolID

        java.lang.String receiveProtocolID()
        Wait for receive response from remote IR Device and extract Protocol ID. You should enable receiver first, calling setReceiverEnable(true)
        Returns:
        ImLib2 Protocol ID as string

      • isReceiverEnabled

        boolean isReceiverEnabled()
        return true if receiver enabled, false otherwise

      • disconnect

        boolean disconnect()
        Disconnect IR Device, closing connection with Arduino
        Returns:
        true if success, false otherwise

      • waitResponse

        java.lang.String waitResponse()
        Wait for IR Remote response from Arduino.
        Returns:
        response as string

      • isPassiveSnifferMode

        boolean isPassiveSnifferMode()
        Returns:
        true if dumpResult() mode is on, false otherwise

      • setPassiveSnifferMode

        boolean setPassiveSnifferMode(boolean value)
        Enable/Disable passiveSnifferMode
        Parameters:
        value - true to enable, false to disable
        Returns:
        true if success, false otherwise

      • isRcvLedOn

        boolean isRcvLedOn()
        Returns:
        true if Receiver Led is on, false otherwise

      • setRcvLedOn

        boolean setRcvLedOn(boolean value)
        Enable/Disable ReceiverLed
        Parameters:
        value - true to enable, false to disable
        Returns:
        true if success, false otherwise

      • setReceiverEnabled

        boolean setReceiverEnabled(boolean value)
        Enable/Disable IR Receiver
        Parameters:
        value - true for enable, false otherwise
        Returns:
        true if success, false otherwise
